message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.DL 

The paper deals with decentralized authorization for IoT devices, which involves security and networking aspects. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves interledger mechanisms and smart contracts, which are related to distributed computing and networking, making cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) likely categories as well. The paper also involves the execution of smart contract code on blockchain nodes, which is related to software engineering, making cs.SE (Software Engineering) a possible category. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed models in terms of execution cost and reduction of data, which are related to machine learning and data analysis, making cs.DL (Machine Learning) a less likely but still possible category.
